meanings.definition: A concave molding used especially in classical architecture
meanings.sent1: The scotia added an elegant touch to the top of the column.
meanings.sent2: The architect included a scotia in the design to give the building a classic look.
meanings.sent3: The scotia on the pillar looked like a little smile, making the building seem friendly.
meanings.sent4: The scotia curved gracefully like a dancer's arched back.
meanings.sent5: The intricate scotia carved into the marble was a masterpiece of craftsmanship.

meanings.definition: A shallow concave molding used in furniture design
meanings.sent1: The scotia on the edge of the table prevented things from falling off.
meanings.sent2: The furniture maker crafted a beautiful scotia on the cabinet doors.
meanings.sent3: The scotia on the chair made it look like it was wearing a fancy hat.
meanings.sent4: The scotia on the dresser was like a gentle wave in the sea of furniture.
meanings.sent5: The smooth scotia on the shelf was perfect for displaying delicate items.
